delto_utility.delto_external_TCP

class delto_utility.delto_external_TCP.Communication[source]

A class to handle communication with a DELTO device over TCP. .. attribute:: delto_socket

The socket used for TCP communication.

type:

socket.socket

__init__()[source]

Initializes the Communication object and sets up the TCP socket.

connect(ip

str = ‘169.254.186.72’, port: int = 10000): Connects to the DELTO device using the specified IP address and port.

get_position_rad() → list[source]

Retrieves the current position of the DELTO device’s fingers in radians.

_combine_msg(data1

int, data2: int) -> int: Combines two bytes of data into a single 16-bit integer, handling sign extension.

send_duty(duty

list): Sends a list of duty cycle values to the DELTO device over TCP.

send_duty(duty: list)[source]

Sends duty cycle values over TCP. This function takes a list of duty cycle values, processes them, and sends them over a TCP connection. The duty cycle values are split into three groups, and each value is converted to two bytes before being placed in the tcp_data_send array. A CRC16 checksum is calculated and appended to the data before sending. :param duty: A list of 12 integers representing the duty cycle values. :type duty: list

delto_utility.delto_modbus_TCP

class delto_utility.delto_modbus_TCP.Communication(dummy=False)[source]

Communication sends command and receives data from Delto Gripper

connect(ip, port, slaveID=1)[source]

Connect to Delto Gripper.

Parameters: ip (str): The IP address of the Delto Gripper. port (int): The port number to connect to. slaveID (int, optional): The slave ID for the Modbus connection. Defaults to 1.

Returns: bool: True if the connection is successful, False otherwise.

fix_position(position: list)[source]

_summary_ accessible from firmware version 1.5 or higher :param position: [0, 1] 0: free, 1: fix :type position: list

get_position() → list[source]

Retrieve the current position of the motors. If the instance is in dummy mode, it returns a list of zeros and logs the function call. Otherwise, it reads the input registers from the Modbus client to get the current position of the motors, adjusts the values if necessary, and returns the positions.

Returns:

A list of motor positions. Each position is adjusted to account for potential

overflow and scaled appropriately.

Return type:

list

set_position(position: list[float])[source]

Sets the position of the device. This method sets the position of the device by writing the provided position values to the modbus registers. The position should be a list of 12 float values. If the dummy flag is set, it logs the function call and returns without setting the position. :param position: A list of 12 float values representing the

desired position.

Returns:

None

Notes

  • The position values are scaled by a factor of 10 and converted to unsigned 16-bit integers before being written to the modbus registers.

  • The method acquires a lock before writing to ensure thread safety.

write_register(address, value)[source]

Write a value to a specific register.

Parameters: address (int): The address of the register to write to. value (int): The value to write to the register.

Returns: None
